And the core thesis, sort of
the meta-argument of this book is very simple. The meta-argument

great era of globalization.

The first I call
globalization 1.0. It began in 1492 and lasted
until the early 1800s,

with the beginning

the world from a size large to a size medium.

And that era of globalization

through your country.

Nation states were the dynamic

Americas, Britain colonizing

India, Portugal, East Asia. You went global
through your country. Globalization 2.0 began
in the early 1800s,

lasted till the year 2000. That's right, it just ended. It shrunk the world from
size medium to size small.

And that era of
globalization was really spearheaded by companies,
companies going global

for markets and for labor. You went global

while I was

the year 2000 to the present.

It's shrinking the world
